public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements GamePlay

This class implements the behaviour expected from the CODE system as required for 2COM0087 Cwk 3 - Feb 2011

hireChampion

public java.lang.String hireChampion(java.lang.String name)
Allows a champion to be added to the army, if there is enough money in the treasury for the hire fee.The champion's state is set to "available"

Specified by:
hireChampion in interface GamePlay
Parameters:
name - represents the name of the champion
Returns:
"Not found" if champion not found, "Not available" if champion not available or already hired, "Hired" if champion hired, "Not enough money" if not enough money in the treasury

isBust

public boolean isBust()
returns true if treasury <=0 and the army has no champions who can be discharged.

Specified by:
isBust in interface GamePlay

meetChallenge

public java.lang.String meetChallenge(int challNo)
Retrieves the challenge represented by the challenge number.Finds a champion from the army who can meet the challenge. The results of meeting a challenge will be one of the following: “Challenge won by...“ – add reward to treasury, return name of champion, “Challenge lost as no champion available” – deduct reward from treasury, “Challenge lost on skill level” - deduct reward from treasury, deduct challenge life cost from champion’s life force. If a challenge is lost and player is bust, add “You are bust” to the output. If challenge is lost and champion is dead, add " is dead".Champion's state is set to RESTING.

Specified by:
meetChallenge in interface GamePlay
Parameters:
challNo - is the reference number of the challenge
Returns:
a String showing the result of meeting the challenge

readChampions

public void readChampions(java.lang.String fileName)
reads data about champions from a text file and stores in collection of champions.Data in the file is "comma separated" and so editable

Parameters:
fileName - name of the file to be read

restoreChampion

public void restoreChampion(java.lang.String name)
Restores a champion to the army by setting their state to AVAILABLE

Specified by:
restoreChampion in interface GamePlay
Parameters:
the - name of the champion to be restored

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the state of the game, including the name of the player, state of the treasury, the champions in the army (or, "No champions" if army is empty)

Specified by:
toString in interface GamePlay
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of the state of the game, including the name of the player, state of the treasury, whether bust or not, and the champions currently in the army,(or, "No champions" if army is empty)
